snippet: When businesses threatened to move across county lines if the minimum wage was raised, a county councilman was able to get three governments to agree to raise it together.
abstract: Marc Elrich, Montgomery County, MD, councilman in Washington DC suburbs, enlists governments of Washington and Prince George’s County to the east, and gets all three governments to agree to raise minimum wages together; regional pact makes it far less tempting for businesses to flee next door and comes as the minimum wage is becoming a defining issue.
lead_paragraph: When businesses threatened to move across county lines if the minimum wage was raised, a county councilman was able to get three governments to agree to raise it together.

headline.main: Fleeing to Next Town, Bosses May Find Minimum Wage Is Rising There, Too
headline.print_headline: Fleeing to Next Town, Bosses May Find Minimum Wage Is Rising There, Too
